action.primary: Promotes the movement of Blood, promotes lactation and invigorates the channels

indications: For painful swellings, especially of the breast or testicles

contraindications: Contraindicated for those with Blood loss disorders and continuous menstrual bleeding.
Use caution and in low dosage for those with Deficiency.

useCases: Blood Stasis leading to menstrual irregularities or amenorrhea.
Amenorrhea, dysmenorrhea, mobile and fixed abdominal masses and accumulations.
Insufficient lactation due postpartum Qi and Blood Deficiency.
Insufficient lactation caused by emotional disturbances.

notes: This herb is said to very fast acting and cannot be stopped by any means.
This herb has been used to treat herpes zoster topically.
This herb is known to be effective in treating prostatitis or benign prostatic hypertrophy.

Both Wang Bu Liu Xing and Squama Manitis #{ChuanShanJia} Chuan Shan Jia promote movement without restraint, excel at unblocking the channels and collaterals to promote movement of Blood and enhance the flow of breast milk and reduce swollen sores. Wang Bu Liu Xing is bitter and neutral with a strong downward action allowing it to induce labor and direct breast milk downward Chuan Shan Jia is salty and cold with a stronger piercing property which allows it to disseminate and unblock organs in the interior, while tracking down Wind and invigorating the collaterals in the exterior. It also expels pus.
Dry-fried Vaccaria Seeds Chao Liu Xing Zi is warm and is stronger in its ability to invigorate the Blood and promote menstruation and is used to treat amenorrhea due to Blood Stasis.
